availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in Baltimore, Maryland on May 18, 1789. Brother of John Norris. Moved to Bracken County, Kentucky in 1807. Served in the War of 1812 under John Pain. Married Lydia Welch on January 27, 1816. Moved to Bourbon County, Kentucky in 1816. Moved to Samgamon County, Illinois in 1827. Fought the Black Hawk in 1832. Moved to Stephenson County, Illinois in 1837. Moved to Shelby County, Mo in 1857. Died on July 31, 1879 in Edina, Knox County, Missouri.

bibl.p: “An Old Soldier Gone,” The Edina Sentinel, August 7, 1879; ; Edwin Porter Thompson, A Young People’s History of Kentucky for Schools and General Reading (St. Louis: A. R. Fleming Publishing Company, 1897), 197; Find A Grave, "Joseph Norris (February 18, 1790 - July 13, 1879)," Memorial #129106505, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi/page/gr/http//fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=129106505 (accessed June 27, 2017).
